results.title: The Moon in the Gutter = la Lune Dans le Caniveau
results.creator_credit: Jean-Jacques Beineix, Lise Fayolle, Gaumont-British Instructional and TF1 Films productions
results.brief_description: Gerard Depardieu plays a dock-worker seeking the rapist responsible for his sister’s death. He becomes involved with a wealthy woman (Nastassia Kinski) who assists him in his search. “The moon in the gutter” is notable for its visual beauty and its stunning camera work and editing. By the director of “Diva” and “Betty Blue” and based on a book by David Goodis.

results.title: Ryan's daughter
results.creator_credit: David Lean, Anthony Havelock-Allan and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Robert Mitchum is the rural school master Charles Shaughnessy who, returning home to Ireland in 1916, just after the Easter Rising against the British, falls in love with and marries one of his old pupils, Rosy Ryan. Their happiness is upset by the arrival of a Major who comes to take command of the British Army and is immediately drawn towards Rosy. Political events finally overtake all affairs of the heart, and it is obvious that life in the village of Kirrary will never be the same again. Scripted by Robert Bolt the film also stars Sarah Miles, John Mills, Trevor Howard and Leo McKern.

results.title: Don't look now
results.creator_credit: Nicolas Roeg, Peter Katz, BL, Casey and Eldorado
results.brief_description: When a little girl is accidentally drowned, her parents (Donald Sutherland and Julie Christie) go to Venice to forget. There they are told by a clairvoyant that their daughter is still very much alive. Adapted from a Daphne du Maurier short story, director Roeg (“Man who fell to Earth” and “Bad Timing”) has created a hypnotic horror film. The film is famous for its effective and shocking editing techniques, as well as its menacing use of the beautiful Venice locations.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nicolas Roeg, Peter Katz, BL, Casey and Eldorado

results.title: Quo Vadis
results.creator_credit: Mervyn LeRoy, Sam Zimbalist and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Describes Rome at the time of Nero, focusing on a Roman commander who falls in love with a Christian girl and becomes a convert himself. A spectacular film, at its most effective where it examines the lives of the early Christians. The Miklos Rozsa score was based on music of the time. Starring Deborah Kerr, Robert Taylor and Peter Ustinov.

results.title: The Magnificent Ambersons
results.creator_credit: Orson Welles and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: The Magnificent Ambersons captures the decline and disintegration of an aristocratic family early in the 20th Century. Within a few minutes the situation is established concisely as we see the large Amberson mansion set in spacious grounds and learn that Isabel Amberson did not marry Eugene Morgan, the man she really loved, but Wilbur Minafer, who was socially acceptable. Much of the story revolves around Isabel’s son George Amberson Minafer, who does much to destroy his family. Based on the novel by Booth Tarkington.

results.title: The Big store
results.creator_credit: Charles Reisner, Louis K Sidney and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: When three wacky private eyes are hired to protect a large department store, it soon becomes apparent that the store needs protection against them. The Marx brothers turn their talents to sleuthing at the request of one of the store owners who fears that her partner is in danger. It doesn’t take them long to handcuff everyone in sight - with the exception of the criminal. Cast includes Groucho Marx, Chico Marx, Harpo Marx, Tony Martin, Virginia Grey.

results.title: Brief encounter
results.creator_credit: David Lean, Noel Coward and Cineguild
results.brief_description: Dr. Alex Harvey (Trevor Howard) and Laura Jesson (Celia Johnson) meet at a railway station and fall in love. Married to other people in middle-class suburban England, they nevertheless maintain an acquaintanceship on her shopping trips to town which deepens into a friendship which blossoms into forbidden love. This is the original screen version of Noel Coward’s one act play, “Still Life”. Atmospherically directed by David Lean, “Brief Encounter” is an evergreen romance classic of post-war English cinema with seamless performances from the leading actors and an excellent music score borrowing heavily from Rachmaninoff. The screenplay was also written by Noel Coward.

results.title: The Jazz Singer
results.creator_credit: Alan Crosland, Jr. and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: A cantor’s son makes it big in show business. Archetypal Jewish weepie which became of absorbing interest as the first talkie film (songs and a few fragments of speech). Stars Al Jolson. Based on the play by Samson Raphaelson. Also includes a segment entitled “Behind the scenes” which documents the premiere of the film.

results.title: Annie Oakley
results.creator_credit: George Stevens, Cliff Reid and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Oscar nominee Barbara Stanwyck stars as Annie Oakley, an Ohio backwoods girl who sets her sights on adventure and romance as the Wild West’s legendary lady sharpshooter. She first gains prominence when she enters a local exhibition with Tony Walker (Preston Foster) who claims to be the world’s greatest marksman and the star of Buffalo Bill’s wild west show. Annie joins the show and soon becomes his star attraction, vying for attention with Toby whom she loves. After the mandatory period of professional rivalry and romantic conflict, they are finally united by a marksman superior to both of them, Cupid.

results.title: Blithe spirit
results.creator_credit: David Lean, Anthony Havelock-Allan, Cineguild and Two Cities Films
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Noel Coward. Charles, a celebrated novelist and his second wife, Ruth, invite a medium to dinner to aid Charles in writing a thriller about mediums. At the seance, unseen by others present, Charles’ first wife, Elvira, appears and although the medium and Ruth attempt to send Elvira back, she has devised a scheme to keep Charles with her forever. Stars Rex Harrison, Kay Hammond, Constance Cummings and Margaret Rutherford.
